Quote: Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: A change in the weather is sufficient to recreate the world and ourselves.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't—you're right.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
Author: Austin Freeman

Quote: The code you write makes you a programmer. The code you delete makes you a good one.
Author: Mario Fusco

Quote: First solve the problem, then write the code.
Author: John Johnson

Quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: You can't get mad at weather because weather's not about you. Apply that lesson to most other aspects of life.
Author: Douglas Coupland

Quote: Climate is what we expect, weather is what we get.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you want to see the sunshine, you have to weather the storm
Author: Frank Lane

Quote: The storm starts, when the drops start dropping, When the drops stop dropping then the storm starts stopping.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: There's no such thing as good weather, or bad weather. There's just weather and your attitude towards it.
Author: Louise Hay

Quote: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
Author: John Steinbeck
